answers.answer: I am 34 weeks and 3 days and my baby is still breeched.... I have an ultrasound tomorrow. I'm hoping my baby turns.
Why are they doing an inversion that early?  Yes, my bub is breech also, almost 37 weeks :/ hope these bubs turn before they are forced. Best of luck
My son was breeched/transversed i went to my 39v week appt yesterday and he finally turned

They are doing it a bit early. Usually they don't manually try to turn baby until 37 weeks. But at least they're trying I hate when they don't even give that option and just say c section. If it doesn't work they can always try again since youbstill have time. Good luck.

Agrip. Thats great, hope your little one stays that way from now on. Hope it wasn't too painful.    Ericatoday- I agree with you, but I also know first hand why they don't always allow bub to be turned. I am in a position at the moment where it may bw too risky for baby, but I still have my fingers crossed that things improve and I can have baby turned for a natural birth.

When they do it I will be 36 week and 6 day an they are saying if the baby hasn't turned my now it most likely not going to and I also have gestational diabetes so they are worried the baby might come early an if she gets any bigger they might be able to turn her I reather have them try to turn her then just getting cut open at 39 weeks

Agrip- Goodluck,  and an early congratulations to you, hope it all goes well. :)    mamatobee- thats understandable- I wush you all the best also, hope everything goes well for you also. Goodluck ladies :)

title: breach baby
